item.title: Calcutta HC orders Mohammed Shami to pay alimony of ₹4 lakh per month to estranged wife, daughter
item.description: Hasin Jahan had lodged an FIR against the Team India bowler and his family in March 2018, four years after their marriage in April 2014, alleging "enormous physical and mental torture"

item.title: Kolkata law college rape case: Accused sent to police custody till July 8
item.description: Kolkata Police said strict legal action would be taken against individuals attempting to disclose the identity of the survivor

item.title: From delivering food to delivering dialogues, the stages in the life of a woman theatre artiste from Kolkata
item.description: Sangita Sarkar, an alumna of the National School of Drama, is directing Moonlight, an adaptation of veteran Marathi playwright Mahesh Elkunchwar’s Sonata

item.title: South Calcutta Law College students, Alipore Court lawyers stage protests over gang rape
item.description: Students organised the protest in front of the college, holding placards and raising slogans for justice, and stressed the need for comprehensive reforms in the governing body of the institute.

item.title: Kolkata law student rape case: College dismisses prime accused, expells two students
item.description: Prime accused and Trinamool student leader Monojit Mishra faced multiple complaints of harassment and molestation in the past, but no action was taken against him

item.title: Kolkata gang rape case: Police warn of action against attempts to reveal victim's identity
item.description: The city police cautioned that sharing any material, including documents, images or social media content that could directly or indirectly reveal the identity of the victim is punishable under relevant legal provisions.

item.title: Bengal police summon Padma-awardee monk after woman alleges rape
item.description: Trinamool, which posted photographs of the monk with top BJP leaders, says the BJP is shielding the accused. Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar hints that the accusation might be politically motivated.

item.title: Independent probe sought in gang rape of law college student case
item.description: Calcutta High Court admits PILs for independent investigation into the gang rape case; BJP delegation visits college

item.title: Classes at South Calcutta Law College suspended, as protests erupt over rape of student
item.description: Bharatiya Janata Party supporters clashed with the police and other protestors in various parts of the city on Monday, June 30, as a four-member fact-finding team of the saffron party arrived in the city

item.title: 683 species added to India’s fauna, 433 taxa to its flora during 2024
item.description: With 101 species, Kerala recorded highest number of fauna discoveries, followed by Karnataka — 82; Tamil Nadu recorded 63 discoveries

item.title: Kolkata gang rape: PIL in Calcutta High Court seeking transfer of probe to CBI
item.description: The petitioner prayed for direction to the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to hold a preliminary inquiry into the incident as complained of by the alleged survivor and file an interim report before the court

item.title: Kolkata gang rape: Accused trio planned the assault, has history of sexually harassing students, say police
item.description: Police say the accused would record such incidents on their mobile phones and later use the footage to blackmail the victims

item.title: Law college gang rape: BJP 'fact-finding team' arrives in Kolkata
item.description: The members of the BJP team include former Union Ministers Satpal Singh, Meenakshi Lekhi and MPs Biplab Kumar Deb and Manan Kumar Mishra.

item.title: People hit streets in Kolkata, add intensity to protests over law college gang rape
item.description: Medico-legal examination and recording of the statement by the survivor have been completed; Kolkata Police expand number of officers in the SIT formed to probe the crime

item.title: Remarks of Trinamool leaders on law college rape put party in a tight spot
item.description: The remarks by senior party MP Kalyan Banerjee and MLA Madan Mitra on the gang rape of a student at South Calcutta Law College has come as an embarrassment to the party

item.title: Kolkata gang rape: Trinamool Congress issues show cause notice to MLA Madan Mitra for ‘insensitive comments’
item.description: “Your (Mitra) uncalled for and insensitive comments on June 28 has affected our party’s image,” the party said in the show cause notice

item.title: Kolkata Law College gang rape: NCW member Archana Majumdar visits crime scene
item.description: NCW member Archana Majumdar claimed that the police could not provide here with the details of the whereabouts of the survivor.

item.title: Indian students opting for Australia as immigration policies tighten in U.S., U.K.: Experts
item.description: Notably, India ranks second in international student enrolments to Australian universities between 2003 and 2024, according to data from the Australian government’s Education Department

item.title: TMC condemns Kalyan Banerjee’s comments on Kolkata law college rape
item.description: Facing flak for his remarks Mr. Banerjee hit back at his own party saying that leaders who joined party after 2011 are responsible for such crimes.

item.title: West Bengal CPI(M) leaders meet family of girl killed in Kaliganj bomb explosion
item.description: The police arrested four more persons in connection with the crude bomb explosion that killed Tammana Khatun, 9, on June 23; among those arrested is a local Trinamool Congress leader, Gawal Sheikh

item.title: Protests escalate over Kolkata student rape case, BJP State President Sukanta Majumdar detained
item.description: Senior Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee’s comment on the rape incident sparks widespread outrage and criticism; Kolkata Mayor Firhad Hakim denies any official association of the prime accused with the Trinamool Congress

item.title: Kolkata Police form five-member SIT to probe into gang rape of law college student
item.description: "An SIT has been formed to probe into the alleged crime. It will start its investigation immediately," the officer said.

item.title: Chirag seeks President's rule in West Bengal after gang rape of Kolkata student
item.description: "Even after 75 years of Independence, the state reports electoral violence, more than any other province," Chirag Paswan alleged

item.title: Accused have TMC links, Mamata should apologise, resign: BJP on Kolkata student gang-rape case
item.description: BJP demands accountability from Mamata Banerjee over gang-rape incident in Kolkata, accusing all accused of TMC affiliation

item.title: NCW Chairperson writes to Bengal Chief Secretary over south Kolkata law college gang-rape
item.description: The commission has also sought an immediate and confidential internal medical examination of the survivor and asked that both internal and external medical reports be submitted to the NCW within three days.

item.title: Kolkata gang-rape case | Security guard of law college arrested
item.description: In her police complaint, the survivor alleged that the guard saw the incident unfold but did not act, instead vacating his room for the crime at the instruction of the main accused

item.title: Kolkata college student rape case: Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee’s comments spark outrage
item.description: “If a friend rapes another friend, then how will the government authorities provide protection in such cases? Do you want to deploy police in educational institutions? Police cannot be in every corner,” Kalyan Banerjee said

item.title: French museum in Chandannagar reopens with its false ceiling missing as ASI delays restoration
item.description: The museum is located in a 1740-built structure called Institut de Chandernagor, popularly known as Dupleix House, where Joseph Francois Dupleix lived as the governor-general when Chandannagar was a French colony.

item.title: Kolkata gang rape case: Medical report ‘does not rule out sexual assault’ of law college student
item.description: Medical exam records abrasion and marks on student’s body; Kolkata police set up SIT to probe allegations, arrest college security guard Pinaki Banerjee; student’s statement recorded before judicial magistrate

item.title: Protests erupt across Kolkata over gang rape of law student; Opposition flays Mamata government
item.description: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari shares pictures of Mishra with Trinamool national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee and other leaders; political parties blame the Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress government for the incident; protests erupt across State

item.title: Condemn gangrape of student in Kolkata college, but incident should not be politicised: TMC
item.description: Social media handles of the prime accused revealed that he is a former president of the college’s Trinamool Congress Chhatra Parishad unit, and the organisational secretary of the south Kolkata wing of the TMC’s student body

item.title: Kolkata student gang rape: NCW writes to Kolkata police chief, seeks time-bound probe
item.description: The women's rights panel has taken suo motu cognisance of the South Kolkata incident.

item.title: Gang rape in Kolkata law college shows female students not safe in State: BJP's West Bengal president Sukanta Majumdar
item.description: “The incident comes after the rape-murder of a doctor in the R.G. Kar Medical College and Hospital last year, an incident that triggered protests across the country,” Sukanta Majumdar said

item.title: Three arrested for gang rape of a student inside law college premises in Kolkata
item.description: The accused include 31-year-old Monojit Mishra, 20-year-old Pramit Mukherjee and 19-year-old Zaib Ahmed. Mishra, a former student is associated with the student wing of Trinamool Congress, and the other two are current students of the college. All three have been remanded to police custody for four days.

item.title: Multiple heritage sites in Bengal, Sikkim starved of funds for two-years
item.description: RTI findings reveal a disconnect between rising tourist interest and plummeting conservation funding at key heritage sites in West Bengal and Sikkim

item.title: R.G. Kar doctor rape-murder case: Calcutta HC says trial court to take call on victim's parents' plea to visit crime scene
item.description: The parents of the murdered R.G. Kar Hospital doctor requested permission to inspect the site of the occurrence of the crime, except the seminar room, where their daughter’s body was found

item.title: Low pressure to bring widespread rain in Bengal: IMD
item.description: Warning that sea conditions are very likely to be rough, the IMD advised fishermen not to venture into the sea along and off the West Bengal-Odisha coast and north Bay of Bengal till Thursday.

item.title: Lakhs of people expected to attend Rathyatra at Digha’s Jagannath Temple, says ISKCON
item.description: ISKCON vice president Radharamn Das said that around 30 lakh people have already visited the Jagannath Temple at Digha since its inauguration on April 30

item.title: Migrants from Bengal being detained in BJP ruled states for speaking in Bengali: CM Mamata
item.description: The Chief Minister said such detentions are being done in BJP ruled states and on some occasion the residents of West Bengal are being “pushed back” in Bangladesh.

item.title: Four BJP MLAs suspended from West Bengal Assembly
item.description: They were suspended from the House due to disobedience towards the Speaker, for allegedly hitting microphones, and misconduct.

item.title: Trinamool Congress wins Kaliganj Assembly by-election, BJP sees silver lining
item.description: After the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, byelections to 11 Assembly constituencies have been held in the State and the Trinamool Congress won all the 11 seats

item.title: West Bengal CM meets new Bangladesh High Commissioner at State Secretariat
item.description: According to officials present at the meeting, the deliberations were held in a “warm and cordial atmosphere” and the Chief Minister reflected her ideas on development of people with the Bangladeshi envoy

item.title: Sex workers stage protest against West Bengal BJP president’s ‘insulting remarks’
item.description: FIR lodged against Sukanta Majumdar’s purported remarks based on a sex worker’s complaint

item.title: Nine-year-old killed in crude bomb attack after Kaliganj bypoll results
item.description: The family members of the deceased Class IV student said they were supporters of the CPI(M) and were targeted by Trinamool Congress supporters after the bypoll results; CM Mamata Banerjee says police will take strong action

item.title: Visva-Bharati to hold march today against vandalisation of Tagore’s ancestral house in Bangladesh
item.description: The Nobel Laureate poet was the founder of Visva-Bharati, which is now a central university

item.title: BJP questions HIDCO’s role in distributing Digha temple prasad
item.description: Across Kolkata, the temple prasad is distributed to people through public distribution system

item.title: Teachers wait for jobs and justice
item.description: More than 25,000 teachers and non-teaching staff have lost their jobs after the Supreme Court found that the appointments were fraught with ‘irregularities’. Thousands of women and men will now have to retake the examination again, to qualify for a teacher’s job. As the West Bengal government prepares for the fresh recruitment process, Shrabana Chatterjee and Moyurie Som speak to those who are unable to reconcile with the idea of going through the recruitment process again

item.title: Massive blaze at chemical factory in Bengal’s Barasat; godowns gutted, 20 engines rushed to the spot
item.description: Fire and Emergency Service minister Sujit Bose says green corridors for fire engines may be in the pipeline

item.title: West Bengal BJP worker found dead
item.description: BJP worker found dead in Hooghly district, sparking political tensions; police investigating alleged "political murder".

item.title: Flood-like situation in South Bengal as rain, DVC water release raise river levels
item.description: Paschim Midnapore, Bankura, Hooghly, and Howrah among affected districts; evacuation, relief efforts underway

item.title: Two killed in crude bomb blast in Bengal's Birbhum district
item.description: The incident reportedly took place on Friday (June 20) night during clashes between two groups over local dominance at Hatia village in the district's Labhapur block.

item.title: Kolkata Police detain Union Minister Sukanta Majumder from meeting ‘dissident’ British-Indian doctor
item.description: The BJP legislator said that the doctor had invited him to his house for tea, and accused the police of blocking him from approaching the doctor’s house, which was allegedly located next to the residence of Trinamool Congress MP Abhishek Banerjee

item.title: BJP leader, Kolkata Police spar over Durga Puja notice
item.description: Kolkata Police clarifies routine safety letter to Durga Puja committee amid accusations of unfair targeting by BJP leader.

item.title: Calcutta High Court stays West Bengal government’s honorarium to Group C, D employees
item.description: The Supreme Court’s April 3 order had annulled the appointment of 25,752 employees, who included teachers and Group C and D employees in State-run schools

item.title: IIT Kharagpur ranks 4th in India, climbs to 215th globally in QS World University Rankings 2026
item.description: QS World University Rankings 2026: IIT Kharagpur ranks 4th in India, 215th globally, showing strong performance in research, reputation, and sustainability.

item.title: TMC slams Opposition after Calcutta High Court stays relief scheme for sacked non-teaching staff; vows legal recourse
item.description: TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh alleged that certain political elements were "deriving monstrous glee" from the misfortune of those who lost their livelihoods

item.title: Calcutta High Court restrains West Bengal Government from giving monetary support to 'jobless' Group C, D school employees
item.description: The Court had on June 9, 2025 reserved judgment on the petitions, which opposed the payment to Group D employees who lost their jobs on the Supreme Court Order, by the State

item.title: Political parties compete to take credit for resumption of MGNREGS in West Bengal
item.description: Court order a ‘significant victory for rural workers and a strong reaffirmation of their right to work under MGNREGA’, says agricultural workers’ union

item.title: Footwear hurled at West Bengal BJP president, Sikhs protests outside party office
item.description: A few days ago, the BJP leader had hurled a poster with a pair of slippers printed on it, which fell on a turban-clad police officer

item.title: Critically ill BJP MP Abhijit Gangopadhyay airlifted to AIIMS Delhi
item.description: The 63-year-old was diagnosed with acute pancreatitis, according to reports from a private hospital in Kolkata

item.title: Assembly bypolls 2025 highlights: Voting concludes in five Assembly constituencies
item.description: Nilambur Assembly segment in Kerala recorded the highest polling percentage of 73.26 % till 8 p.m., the lowest was recorded in Ludhiana West (51.33 %) in Punjab; Kadi saw a voter turnout of 54.49 %, Visavadar (54.61 %) and Kaliganj (69.89 %).

item.title: BJP, Trinamool wage war of words over West Bengal’s revised OBC list
item.description: BJP welcomes Calcutta High Court’s interim stay on the notification of a new OBC list; Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee says the revised list will benefit poor people, was prepared by OBC Commission

item.title: ‘Solidarity, not sympathy’: Kolkata campaign centres dignity of the elderly
item.description: Citywide initiative highlights mental health and dignity of senior citizens, culminating in a conference on June 22

item.title: Mamata Banerjee objects to Union government using the term Samvidhan Hatya Divas
item.description: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari said the day is a way for BJP to pay tribute to all people who were behind bars during the Emergency

item.title: MGNREGA to resume in West Bengal after nearly three-year abeyance, says Calcutta High Court
item.description: Court says scheme cannot be kept in ‘cold storage’; directs Centre to act prospectively

item.title: Calcutta HC orders interim stay on notification of OBC list in W.B.
item.description: On June 10, the West Bengal government tabled a new OBC list in the State Assembly with minor changes compared to the previous list. The Calcutta High Court in May 2024 had cancelled the OBC reservation awarded to 77 categories

item.title: More West Bengal migrants pushed into Bangladesh, repatriated after State’s intervention
item.description: TMC MP and Chairperson of the West Bengal Migrant Welfare Board Samirul Islam said seven migrants had been recently pushed into Bangladesh by the BSF, and then repatriated back

item.title: West Bengal Assembly passes Bill on ‘transparency’ in medical costs in private facilities
item.description: The Bill aims to regulate the licensing process of clinical establishments, increase transparency in functioning, ensure adherence to rates, and mandate electronic medical record-keeping

item.title: Fire at Kolkata market ‘man-made’, says Suvendu Adhikari
item.description: The West Bengal government has refuted allegations made by the Opposition with Minister Sujit Bose saying that “some people are trying to spread rumours”

item.title: Air India flight from San Francisco to Mumbai suffers technical snag; passengers deplaned in Kolkata
item.description: Flight AI180 arrived on time at 0045 hrs at the airport but the technical snag in the left engine resulted in the take off getting delayed.

item.title: BJP MLAs walk out from West Bengal Assembly; one suspended, another cautioned
item.description: Manoj Oraon was suspended for the day for improper conduct during Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee’s address; the Speaker cautioned BJP Chief Whip Sankar Ghosh

item.title: BJP goverments targeting Bengalis; labelling them Bangladeshi for speaking their tongue: Mamata
item.description: The Chief Minister’s remarks came a day after three residents of West Bengal, working in Mumbai were allegedly forced into Bangladesh by the BSF

item.title: Massive fire in Kolkata’s Khidirpur market area guts hundreds of shops; no casualties reported
item.description: 20 engines rushed to the spot; Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee offers compensation for all affected shop owners

item.title: TMC's Abhishek criticises Centre for 'lack' of accountability over Pahalgam attack
item.description: Calling it a "massive breach in national security", Abhishek Banerjee asked who would take responsibility for the "failure"

item.title: Three West Bengal residents pushed into Bangladesh by BSF, return after State govt.’s intervention
item.description: Trinamool Congress MP Samirul Islam says that when the workers were picked up by the police in Mumbai, all necessary documents were provided by the State government

item.title: Protesting teachers in Bengal go on hunger strike ‘till government meets demands’
item.description: ‘Sacked and untainted’ teachers have raised questions on why the application deadline for fresh recruitments is set before the Supreme Court can take a decision on the review petition.

item.title: Violence returns to WB jute industry, manager assaulted
item.description: A senior official of Auckland Jute mill in North 24-Parganas was assaulted following which the management of the Jute mill put a suspension of work notice putting at stake the livelihood of around 4,000 workers.

item.title: West Bengal clashes: Senior police officers in Rabindra Nagar transferred post-violence
item.description: Leader of the Opposition Suvendu Adhikari offers compensation to violence affected people

item.title: Not Abhishek’s only Mamata’s photos on Trinamool Martyrs’ Day rally
item.description: Abhishek Banerjee opts out, citing absence from 1993 movement; leadership seeks to contain infighting in Birbhum ahead of rally

item.title: Row erupts in Bengal over vandalism at Tagore’s ancestral house in Bangladesh
item.description: Trinamool and BJP spar over incident; Mamata writes to PM, Suvendu calls it attack on shared heritage

item.title: Calcutta University teams up with Darjeeling college to preserve and promote Lepcha language
item.description: Workshop aims to connect endangered language and literature of hill communities to wider audiences

item.title: West Bengal School Service Commission holds talks with ‘sacked’ teachers
item.description: Hundreds of ‘untainted’ teachers, who lost their jobs after an April 3 Supreme Court order invalidating nearly 26,000 teaching and non-teaching jobs, gathered at Karunamoyee in Bidhannagar and marched to the WBSSC office

item.title: West Bengal clashes: Tension lingers in the lanes of Rabindra Nagar; locals reel in the aftermath
item.description: Streets tense in Rabindra Nagar as vandalism, stone-pelting and arson leave trail of destruction; senior officials claim situation under control

item.title: 40 arrested over violence in Maheshtala; Bengal BJP seeks deployment of Central forces
item.description: State BJP says police trying to whitewash a ‘communal attack’; Trinamool accuses BJP of creating tension

item.title: CBI submits fourth status report in R.G. Kar rape and murder case
item.description: The parents of the victim have on multiple occasions shared their dissatisfaction with CBI probe and said they are dragging their feet

item.title: OBC quota deadlock dominates politics in West Bengal; new list an appeasement move, says BJP
item.description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee says“backwardness”was the only benchmark to decide OBC category. LOP Suvendu Adhikari claimed that new list being prepared by West Bengal government is aimed at “appeasement politics”.

item.title: Clashes in Bengal leaves several police personnel injured, vehicles vandalised
item.description: Several police personnel sustained injuries while trying to control the situation. A number of police vehicles were also set on fire by the mob, which was seen pelting stones at the police

item.title: Statewide anti-drug abuse campaign by Kolkata’s top government hospital is now focusing on students
item.description: ‘There is a real need for more support for students in schools and colleges when it comes to their mental and emotional health,’ the campaign leader said

item.title: Highlighting 11 years of Modi govt., BJP attacks TMC govt.
item.description: BJP legislators and Union Ministers Bhupendra Yadav and Sukanta Majumdar express confidence in the BJP forming the government in West Bengal following Assembly elections in 2026 and say it will “restore the State’s legacy and glory”.

item.title: West Bengal Assembly unanimously passes resolution lauding armed forces
item.description: Mamata Banerjee says that during the conflict “there was an opportunity to capture Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir”; Opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari asks why reference to “Operation Sindoor” was absent in the Assembly resolution

item.title: Backwardness only benchmark to decide OBC status, not religion: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee
item.description: Mamata Banerjee said a Commission set up by the government is holding a survey on 50 new subsections for inclusion in that category

item.title: Wazahat Khan, the man who filed FIR against influencer Sharmistha Panoli, arrested in Kolkata
item.description: The 29-year-old Wazahat Khan has been booked under Bhartiya Nyay Sanghita’s Sections 196(1)(a)/299/352/353(1)(c). He was absconding for the past 10 days.

item.title: Mamata Banerjee holds meet on COVID preparedness, says there is no reason to panic
item.description: Public health facilities in State are ready to help affected persons with any medical issues, she says

item.title: Congress defector given top party post by TMC
item.description: Malakar represented the Matigara Naxalbari Assembly seat for two terms in 2011 and 2016 and is a prominent Scheduled Caste leader

item.title: Calcutta High Court questions State over honorarium for sacked non-teaching staff
item.description: Justice Amrita Sinha seeks clarity on public spending for staff dismissed in tainted 2016 recruitment; reserves order

item.title: Will bring Sandeshkhali perpetrators to justice after BJP comes to power in W.B., says Suvendu
item.description: Sheikh Shahjahan, former Trinamool Congress leader from Sandeshkhali block in North 24 Parganas district, faces allegations of land grab and sexual assault by several women in the region

item.title: Protester in Bangladesh student uprising of 2024 is a voter in W.B.’s Kakdwip
item.description: Newton Das, whose photos of being involved in Bangladesh revolution is available in public domain, says that he is a voter of Kakdwip Assembly seat in W.B. since 2014. His relatives say he has voting rights in both the countries

item.title: Poor rural roads in West Bengal blamed for accidents, fatalities ahead of monsoon
item.description: Families allege negligence amid muddy, dilapidated roads; political blame game intensifies over infrastructure woes

item.title: Nine country-made bombs recovered in West Bengal's Purba Bardhaman
item.description: A Bomb Disposal Squad was rushed to the spot, which safely defused the bombs on the Damodar riverbed,

item.title: Two separate rape incidents reported in Kolkata; one survivor a minor
item.description: Both perpetrators arrested by Kolkata Police; one of the accused is a medical student
